result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order of Supreme Court
Motion for Continuance.
for Attorney Withdrawal
Re: Order for Attorney Withdrawal

Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  10:31 a.m. 
State appears by Atty Devra Ayala by video.  
Defendant appears by video from Waupun Correctional with Atty Angela Chodak by video. 

Date and time set for hearing on Atty Chodak's motion for withdraw. 
COURT recites history of matter; notes defendant has written a letter to request extension to file response to motion to withdraw (Doc 692).
Defendant makes statement and is in process of drafting response. 
COURT questions parties re: any objections and defendant's request for extension. 

Atty Chodak objects to extension for time for defendant to file response; makes objections for record. 
COURT addresses defendant and makes findings re: request. 
Defendant makes arguments re: request for extension of time. 
Atty Chodak makes further objections. 
Defendant makes arguments re: counsel and appellate procedures. 
COURT makes findings and grants Atty Chodak's motion to withdraw.  
COURT denies defendant's request for extension; COURT further finds defendant has waived or forfeited right to public defender appointment. 
COURT advises defendant new attorney will not be appointed. 
Atty Chodak will submit Order to Court.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: from Atty General Dufour re: hearing(stj)

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 3:34pm
Atty Devra Ayala appears by phone on behalf of State; Defendant appears by phone from WI State Prison System/pro se.

COURT notes Mr. Torgerson is requesting more time in the library each week and more time to view discovery.
COURT also notes current time defendant has been afforded.
Atty Ayala notes email from prison system regarding the requests.
COURT directs that intent is for Mr. Torgerson's time to be maximized without being at expense of other inmates, but has no information from prison.
Atty Ayala will get information from emails for COURT to review from prison.
Mr. Torgerson makes statement on request -- Atty Ayala will contact prison and get further information and report back to defendant/COURT.
Mr. Torgerson requests discovery discussed 2/26/16, re: boat and Jeep; Atty Ayala to follow up on that request.
Mr. Torgerson states he does not have signed copy of protective order / release of funds - Atty Ayala will send Mr. Torgerson another signed copy.
Mr. Torgerson addresses letter dated 3/6/16 re: contact w/daughter; Atty Ayala makes statement re: daughter's age/mother needing to read; COURT makes note that rules of the prison must be followed along with the orders that exist in this case by this COURT.
Mr. Torgerson filed discovery request dated 3/4/16 sent to DOJ, and questions Atty Ayala as to timing; Atty Ayala will respond as soon as able.

Adj: 3:55pm
Order for Library and Computer Access (sent to Br. 4)
for Discovery dated March 4, 2016 from defendant (sent to Br. 4)
dated March 6, 2016 re: attachments and question (stj)
to Judge Grau from dft - stj
From Department of Justice to Def RE: CDs
Protective Order and Order to Release Funds
Hearing held on 2/26/16 before Judge Greg Grau

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 9:39am
Attys Richard Durfour and Ayala appear by phone on behalf of State; Defendant appears by phone from WI State Prison System.

COURT Notes letter sent to parties to address several issues today.

COURT addresses 2/3/16 letter from defendant re: Informants, response letter from Atty Durfour and reply from defendant>>
COURT questions if issue is disclosure of informant - Atty Durfour notes names of each; Defendant requesting addresses of each of those informants - Atty Durfour makes argument against disclosure of addresses.
COURT ORDERS defendant may not disclose address of witness A.W. - Defendant states understanding and Atty Durfour to draft order.
Atty Durfour objects to disclosure of  witness R.H. address to defendant - Argument by defendant; COURT denies any deposition requested by defendant; COURT makes findings - Motion for protective order granted denies request for address disclosure of witness R.H - Atty Durfour to draft order.

COURT Addresses 2/5 and 2/11 letters of defendant concerning release of his inmate release account funds>>
COURT questions defendant regarding inmate account - Defendant requesting release of money to defendant for use of the defense in his case; State does not take position on this issue; COURT enters order to warden of prison where defendant is housed, requiring immediate release of all of defendant's funds in inmate release accounts to use toward his defense in this case -- Atty Durfour to draft order.

COURT addresses letter 2/6 re: crime lab  findings on boat>>
COURT notes item has been analyzed  -- Argument by defendant and by Atty Ayala re: photos/notes; Atty Ayala states notes/photos will be provided to defendant as soon a they are received

COURT addresses letters filed by Defendant re: defendant's vehicle>>
COURT notes jeep  evidence and has been analyzed - Atty Durfour notes information will be provided to defendant.

COURT address 2/16 Letter of defendant and 2/12 letter from Atty Durfour re: alleged drug trafficking operation involving defendant at MCJ>>
COURT notes defendant requesting monitored discussions.
Atty Durfour will attempt to obtain - COURT makes ruling.

COURT addresses 2/14/16 document re: discovery issues>>
Defendant notes he is unable to accesses discs nor can prison staff; Answer by Atty Durfour re: several videos/discs efforts to copy and provide corrupted disc.
COURT notes another issue in that document is re: Atty Jazgar and COURT will not be involved in getting information

#1 - Waiver of Right to An Attorney

Case called:  9:03 am
Clerk:  Kim

State appears by Asst. Atty General, Richard Dufour and co-counsel Atty Devra Ayala.  Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Atty Jeffrey Jazgar.

Date and time set for Motion Hearing. COURT reviews motions before the court --
Atty Jzagar's motion re: status as standby counsel.
Defendant's motion for Atty Jazgar to w/draw as counsel.
Letter from defendant wishing to represent himself.

Court addresses Atty Jazgar's motion.  Atty Jazgar addresses court.  Court makes findings and grants motion to w/draw.  COURT informs defendant he may go to the State Public Defender's Office for appointment of new counsel.  COURT advises defendant of the difficulties and dangers of self representation. Defendant to complete Waiver of Right to an Attorney form.  

Court takes recess 9:55 am . 
Court reconvenes 10:00 am.  Same appearances.  

Waiver of right filed by defendant.  COURT questions defendant as to the understanding of waiver.  COURT has waiver marked as exhibit one and receives.    
COURT further informs defendant of his right to an attorney during trial.  Defendant acknowledges he understands.
COURT questions defendant if he understand the charges.  Defendant acknowledges he understands.  
COURT questions if he still wishes  to proceed without an attorney. Defendant wishes to proceed without an attorney.
COURT questions defendant if he reads and understands the english language.  Defendant acknowledges he does understand.
State questions defendant if he has a learning disability.  COURT further questions.  Defendant states he does not.
COURT finds defendant freely, voluntarily and knowlingly waives his right to counsel.
COURT addresses scheduling order and discs received from DOC.
State review with Court letter of January 12, and discs.
COURT sets Proposed Scheduling order -- 
All motions must be filed by 3/18/16, and than 3/18/16 each party submit to court a list naming each motion pending to be heard and dates filed.   During the week of 3/21/16,  approximatley 15 minute phone conference to verify all motions to be heard at hearng.  Each party will have to court by 4/29/16 to file response.  On 5/2/16 have phone conference to verify any response that have been submitted.  The last two days of the first trial date 5/26 and 5/27 to hear all motions.  State to make good faith effort to supply Discovery request to defendant.  Atty Jazgar to turn over everyithing to defendant.  State to reduce Proposed Scheduling Order to writing and submit to Court.  COURT will review, sign and submit  to parties.
COURT sets trial date.   State will need full 3 weeks. Defendant objects he has no Discovery.  Court will afford time fair and appropirate. 
JURY TRIAL set for 7/18/16 at 8:30 am for three weeks.
State addresses proposed juror questionnaire and verdict before. trial.  COURT alllows 5/26 and 5/27 for Motion for Change of Venue.  If occurs that might impact juror questionnaire.   State request to pick jury from another county and have trial In Marathon Co.  COURT states it's most likely jury will be picked from another county and will likely come back here.  Defendant requests witness list to prepare for motion hearing.  State has already submitted expert witness lsit.  COURT requests witness and expert lists by 4/29/16.  Atty Jazgar gives his witnes list to defendant.  State revisits issue of confidental address for Ms. Wadinski.  Court will make decision at time of motion. Defendant addresses court re: delay in expert witness list - waiting for full Discovery.  Court states if file motion filed, will rule on it.  No further scheduling.
COURT addresses received package in mail form DOC.  State files letter with Court.  Court reads letter from DOC.  State addresses discs.  New copy of disc three to be made and sent to defendant.  Defendant states he has not received all discs.  Court asks State to make inquiry of DOC re access of Discovery. State will complete.  COURT wants him to be able to view Discovery at prison and will sign order.    Court questions how discs will be returned back to DOC. COURT will take care of returning discs.  Defendant requests transcrpt of proceedings.  Court makes requests of court reporter.   
Parties to set up telphonic conference and verify with prison if availabe for those times after court.. 
Adj. 10:54 am

IT IS ORDERED that the petition is denied.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the motion for appointment of counsel is denied as moot.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the motion for time to provide a copy of the judgment is denied.

Cases 12CF565, 12CF745 and 14CF860 called: 1:20pm
State appears by ADA K.Mayo and Special Prosecutor Richard Dufour; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney Leonard Kachinsky.
(Motion to Withdraw as Counsel)

COURT notes Atty Kachinsky has filed Motions to Withdraw in all 3 cases, and correspondence filed
Atty Kachinsky makes statement regarding withdrawal -- COURT questions if defendant is firing counsel or if Atty Kachinsky is withdrawing; Response by Atty Kachinsky - defendant wants him to withdraw; Defendant states Atty Kachinsky is ineffective and requests new counsel be appointed.

COURT calls upon Atty Suzanne O'Neill for information regarding  - will get first person on the list who is available capable of handling felony case; Atty O'Neill warns of manipulation of resources.
COURT questions defendant if he understands the information given by Attorney O'Neill; Defendant makes statement.
Atty Dufour requests STC as soon as counsel 

in 860 case - COURT deems defendant has dismissed Atty Kachinsky and PD to appoint new counsel in that file
COURT notes several numous motions filed by defendant - COURT addresses motions, defendant does not have right to counsel and to represent himself simultaneously, so motions cannot be addressed at this time as counsel is being 
COURT will not hear any motions, demands and requests at this time - will not address them until and unless defendant's new counsel requests hearing to address them.
Defendant states his request is for anything defendant himself authored and sent to Attorney Kachinsky -- COURT questions defendant on that issue
COURT directs Atty Kachinsky to purge file of any document sent by defendant to him and any response by him in writing, and send them to defendant personally at prison address.

12CF745 -- Defendant has brought motion regarding Atty Kachinsky being dismissed from both 12CF745 and 12CF565; Atty Kachinsky and defendant make statements. COURT makes findings - COURT denies Atty Kachinsky's motion to withdraw in both 12CF cases, and Atty Kachinsky to continue as counsel on those two cases.

COURT directs parties to set STC/SC with COURT in approx 2 weeks - counsel may appear by phone for that hearing; Defendant may also appear by phone if he wishes.
Defendant states he will have to dismiss appeal on 12CF files since there is now a perceived conflict; COURT questions defendant - Defendant withdraws appeals in 12CF745 and 12CF565 - COURT considers those appeals withdrawn.
